synopsis: In episode #12 of PBR, hosts Devam and Ahir welcome the talented musician and teacher Valente, who shares his inspiring journey through personal struggles, creativity, and the importance of connection. The conversation beautifully explores themes of existence, the creative process, and the impact of community, leaving listeners with a sense of hope and introspection.
quotes: If you want to make the world a better place, take a look at yourself and make a change.
Life needs to happen for a while in order for me to have something to express.
Just because you're not giving up all of your possessions doesn't mean you're not helping and being kind.
It's a fine line between survivors guilt and a savior complex.
I always felt very safe and taken care of by all older people around me.
You can always find a reason to beat yourself up about your own privilege.
Everything is always changing; it's dangerous to think you've found the answer.
I think a lot about my students and I try to give them a sense of peace if I can.
You have to think about existing and living as well.
This is the perfect music to exist to.
